website_summaries.verdict: These premium hemp liners are exceptionally absorbent and won’t add unnecessary bulk to your baby’s diaper. A great option for heavy wetters or nighttime use.
pros: Six layers of plush hemp combined with organic cotton delivers superb comfort and absorbency
Locks in moisture and prevents nighttime leaks
Much thinner than others without sacrificing absorbency
Trim construction makes it easy to add another layer of protection without causing diapers to bulge
cons: Superior absorbency also means they take longer to dry

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Inserts!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite inserts! I have been cloth diapering for over 3 years and my friend introduced me to these inserts earlier this year. I received some as a gift and just bought more because after several months of use they are definitely my favorite! I out them in all sorts of brands of pocket diapers and they are incredibly soft and absorbent. I don't see a need for any size other than small as they fit both my newborn and my 25lb 2year old very well.
customer_reviews.author: Shantel H.

customer_reviews.title: LoveD these
customer_reviews.text: I loved these inserts. First of all I feel comfortable putting these right up against my baby's skin. The cloth diapers were leaking, and I was getting frustrated cleaning crib sheet multiple times a day. I heard great things about these inserts, and I see why. They're soft, thick, and very absorbent. This means I can go an hour and a half or two hours before needing to change the diaper. Unfortunately 2/4 I have bought have formed small holes. They are all less than two months old. This isn't acceptable, and I am on the search for ones that are equally as absorbent, but don't get holes
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye bamboo/microfiber! Hello hemp!
customer_reviews.text: I have tons on bamboo-microfiber inserts, but I’m gonna get rid of them. THESE HEMP INSERTS are everything. They’re the best inserts I’ve ever used in my years of CDing. I’m mad that I haven’t used these until now. They’re easy to clean and don’t stain easily. They’re amazingly absorbent. For as thin as they are I didn’t expect them to be as absorbent, but they are the most absorbent inserts I have ever used! They do shrink a little bit after washing, but they START big, so they took shrinkage into account. I am including pictures of the before the wash/dry and after. And you can see how well they fit in cloth diapers & shells even after shrinkage.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after reading the reviews posted here. Agree with others that it works great so far, shrink a little, but takes a long time to dry. One thing that annoys me greatly and thus I only rated this with a 3 stars is that taking the tags off was a pain. You have to be very careful with it, or you'll easily snip the fabric off. Then, after you have spent a good 5+ minutes snipping off the tag, you realize there's a hole left behind still. I'm very sure that after about a dozen of washings, that hole will be much bigger. I just don't understand what's the need for tagging the insert the way they do?
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds great, shrinks to size.
customer_reviews.text: They look huge pre-wash. But dont worry. They shrink after a few washes. My pictures show the comparison of one washed several times and a brand new one. I had trouble finding anything to hold my little guy through the night. One of these, a fitted, a charcoal insert and a cover... Boom!
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Work well but very pricey
customer_reviews.text: I got these and a pack of happy endings heavy wetters (at nearly half the price per insert) and they honestly are about the same. Thirsties are softer and slightly more trim but I use pockets so softness doesn't make a huge difference for me. Everyone hypes up Thirsties inserts but for me they didn't really live up to the hype, especially for the hefty price tag.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Dry all night
customer_reviews.text: My daughter isn't night time potty trained and she's a heavy wetter. We've been using either a large pullup or goodnite diaper and 2 disposable pads every night for years. We tried a ton of pocket diaper insert combinations (even 3 pads at once) and her bed was always wet. Now we do 1 microfiber pad with one of these hemp pads underneath stuffed into an alva pocket diaper and we're 3 for 3 nights now no leaks! They do take a little longer to dry than other types of pads but definitely worth it. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: These are great. The Hemp holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: These are great. The Hemp holds a lot, and the top layer is soft against my baby's skin. We had been using prefolds in the Thirsties covers, but he screams each time he wets as he hates the wet feeling. Somedays I was changing my 2 month old every 20 mins! These allow him to nap without waking up, which is a HUGE plus! The wash up well, no staining so far with my newborn EBF poo. The hemp does take longer to dry, but hey, it holds a lot of water, so what do you expect?
customer_reviews.author: Misty Troyer

customer_reviews.title: Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying cheap versions of these for the past year and my littls one would leak through her diaper within an hour. It was making me frustrated. Being 18 months in, I didnt really want to purchase more diapers or inserts but if I hadn't I would be switching it disposables. So I bought a pair of these to the Bumgenius AIO and she can now go about 4 hours before leaking through! I ended up buying more to fit all the diapers I have. I wish I hadn't spent so much money on cheap versions. I wish I had found these before 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquin Labrado

customer_reviews.title: Ordering More!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely no complaints. We’ve been using the Thirsties Hemp inserts for an extra layer in my toddlers night time diapers for several weeks now. At the same time, I also purchased a waterproof changing pad because he was soaking through his pajamas at night. We haven’t even needed it!!! I purchased another brand of cotton/hemp inserts along with these and I found myself grabbing for Thirsties every time. I really like how soft the outer layer is, it’s easy to stuff into pockets, air dries virtually flat and isn’t stiff or scratchy. Five stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Great for overnight
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are perfect for bulking up night diapers. They are thin enough that our six month old can wear two inserts with a prefold to easily last all night, although using just one would take him through most nights anyway. We have also used these during the day when he went through a stage of heavy wetting, or when we might be out longer, such as hiking or car trips. As others have noted, they do take a little bit longer to dry. These are usually just a bit damp coming out of the dryer. We hang them up on a drying rack or over the back of a chair and they are fine in a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent but hard to dry
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely absorbent and work best under a quick absorber like 100% cotton insert. We use them to boost night and nap time diapers. The only problem is that that they take forever to dry, but found a TRICK FOR DRYING! We put them in the basement near our dehumidifier and they dry fully in a couple of hours!
customer_reviews.author: Neuropenguin

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency, very trim
customer_reviews.text: I am SO glad I splurged on these! They are hands down my favorite inserts. Very trim, and super absorbent. I use them with thirsties covers and also occasionally use them with a microfiber inside my pocket diapers. They are a great way to boost absorbency without adding much bulk. They do take longer to dry (in my dryer and on my rack) than other inserts I have, but I am fine to toss them into the dryer with my next load or let them hang dry longer. Great item! If you’re on the fence, they are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: None

customer_reviews.title: My workhorse inserts
customer_reviews.text: It takes a few washings to break it in but after that, they're great! I have a heavy wetter so I use two of these wrapped in an FST and a cover for nighttime and experience no leaking in the morning! Even with two at night, the dupe is still relatively trim! During the day, I can get away with one wrapped in an FST and it works perfectly!!
customer_reviews.author: Mombieof3

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: [We exclusively use cloth diapers] Our son started sleeping 10-12 hours at night and we noticed he started leaking through his diapers since it was so much pee! Now we insert 1 regular insert and put this hemp insert under the other one and tada! Works like a charm. No more leaks.. even when he sleeps 12 hours! They soak up so much! Tip: they do take much longer to air dry than regular inserts. We bought 6 and wash diapers every 2-3 days.. that rotation seems to work well and they dry in the time that they're needed.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: GREAT inserts for cloth diapering!
customer_reviews.text: These are some of the best inserts. They hold a lot of liquids. The more you wash them the more absorbent they get! They fit perfect in a cover or in a pocket diaper. They wash clean because they are not too thick to wash out right. I love them and would buy them over and over. They are also great as a booster for night time as your child gets older and bigger. I highly recommend! In my photo my son had on a pocket diaper stuffed with 2 of thirsties hemp inserts and it worked wonderfully!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best insert on the market. No doubt!
customer_reviews.text: No better cloth diaper insert. Cleans well, absorbs well, and can be used directly against skin in a wrap or inside a pocket. Works best with a faster absorbing material on top like cotton or microfiber (remember microfiber cannot touch skin). Our go to night diaper is a cotton prefold on top of one of these in a wrap or pocket. My toddlers never leak and they’ve worn them for 14 hours. Thank you Thirsties!
customer_reviews.author: D E F

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs tons, but takes forever to dry
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly absorbent, but wow do they take forever to dry after being washed. I've put them through two dry cycles and air dried them, and they were still damp. They're not as soft as other materials, and actually feel a bit starchy. Overall they do what I want though, and that is to absorb lots of liquid.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Our son is now 15m old and was looking for something to hold up during card rides or lots and overnight. We use pocket diapers and have used 2 microfiber inserts for the day. Noticed at his weight/size the micro inserts are bending in the pocket from certain movement or car rides causing some minor leaks. I now use 1 of these hemp inserts underneath 1 microfiber and solved the issue. I also use this for overnight diapering and has helped him make it 1w hours through the night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome inserts
customer_reviews.text: I had been struggling with finding the right insert for my toddler's diaper, every type of cotton or microfiber combo I was using kept leaking. Then I found these. They are amazing! Super absorbent but at the same time thin enough that they don't make the diaper get super bulky. Because the hemp is slow to absorb I do couple this with an infant microfiber insert as well. We've been using them for a few months now and haven't had any issues with leaks even overnight. I highly recommend these inserts.
customer_reviews.author: Jc

customer_reviews.title: Order them!
customer_reviews.text: I love Thirsties products! They are a great company with a great mission. Laura, their social media coordinator is great! Her live videos about their products are always so helpful and informative. These are my go to for night time to add some extra absorbency. They are great quality and we have never had any leaks in the morning. Plus, they are super trim so they don’t bulk up your diaper too much. I have multiple packs of these so I never run out. LOVE THIRSTIES!
customer_reviews.author: Biesanz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful inserts!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these inserts as night time doublers with my other brand bamboo inserts for pocket diapers, and they are amazing. Perfect fit, and the combo gets my 4mo old medium nighttime wetter through the night, with no leaks. These inserts are stiffer, due to the fabric, especially when wet, but not uncomfortably so, and will be heavily relied on for the next two years!
customer_reviews.author: IowaMom09

customer_reviews.title: Just buy these. You won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.text: I was severely struggling to find an overnight solution to cloth diapering. Thanks to these bad boys I have ditching the disposables at night time and cloth diapering with ease. I was amazed at first with how large they are but these amazing guys shrink up perfectly in the wash. The only mildly annoying thing is they take Forever to dry. But that shows how absorbent they are. Just get them you will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to cloth diaper set
customer_reviews.text: When PULs were not cutting it for overnights, we completely changed our nighttime routine to add cloth diapers (Set of 4 Night Time Fitted Cloth Diapers One-Size 7-30 Lb (Hemp /Organic Cotton)) along with these inserts and a cover. The results have been fantastic. We could not be happier now that she is sleeping through the night. They are a great size, and so thin! You wouldn't believe how much they take in! It is a good to put a thin microfiber insert over to help with absorption, but we haven't had an issue yet. We got four, and sometime use for her long morning nap. Great buy, and always love that Thirsties is American made.
customer_reviews.author: Nicci B

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for overnight cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: These inserts solved our overnight cloth diapering dilema! I pair one of these great Thirsties Hemp inserts with a regular microfiber insert in any one of our pocket diapers. (Microfiber closest to baby inside the pocket) Very very rarely have a leak with this system! I’ve found that the affordable pocket diapers sold on Amazon (Baby Goal, Mama Koala and Alva) work really well for daytime use with their included inserts and then doubled up with these Thirsties Hemp inserts for nighttime. 100% would recommend these to anyone. Make sure you wash twice before use!
customer_reviews.author: Honest mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are amazing. If they were cheaper I would buy more. I use these under a flat or prefold for my night time heavy wetter. I love them. I was fed up with leaks and decided to spend the money on these and so happy I did. They take a bit longer to dry but I hang them outside when it’s nice out and pop them in the dryer for a bit to soften them up. I can’t say enough good things about these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I use these as a doubler for my heavy wetter for over nights. He still leaks through occasionally but it's been much approved. They're great quality and very absorbent. My only wish is that they where just a little bit longer, not sure if we'll be able to use these all the way until potty training. He's 16 months a they're a perfect fit now. Not sure how much growing room he's got left.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Freak

customer_reviews.title: Good absorbency, poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I love these inserts for the absorbency (we use them overnight combined with a Thirsties aio and have never had a leak), but after just a couple weeks of normal use both inserts I purchased have holes in them. Updated to add: I contacted the manufacturer and they said holes are normal after just a couple weeks of light use so I probably will not be buying these again as they aren’t going to hold up as well as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Best Doubler
customer_reviews.text: Awesome doublers. My little one is a heavy wetter and because cloth diapers couldn't contain everything,(even with a different doubler or even doubled inserts) I was forced to use disposables. I didn't stop searching for a way to go back to cloth though. I read that hemp is super absorbent and decided to give it a try. I purchased Thirsties hemp doublers and they have been amazing. No leaks and it's been over a month. They aren't thick so my little chunk chunk doesn't look even bigger and keeps her legs closer for walking. I boiled them for 10-15 minutes then washed once before first use. Worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L.

customer_reviews.title: May work for you, did not for me
customer_reviews.text: I have just recently began using these in my diapers. I am surprised because everyone says hemp is the go to for night time diapering for heavy wetters. However, I have used these twice in combination with two bamboo inserts andI am not sure why my son who is only 5 months can not go 6 hours sleep time without soaking through.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: So far these inserts have worked wonderfully. I use them at night along with a microfiber insert and we can make it through 12 hours at night with no issues. They take a lot longer to dry than other inserts which makes sense since they are so absorbent. I would definitely recommend using these inserts if you are looking to cloth diaper or just add to your stash. These will make a great addition!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hole after first wash
customer_reviews.text: I love my old thirsties hemp inserts and my original pack is still in rotation three years later - but one of the ones that I just ordered has gotten a small hole after the first wash. What a bummer! Hope it’s just a lemon and they’re not changing the materials.
customer_reviews.author: ladybug

customer_reviews.title: Work like a charm to keep baby dry at night
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are amazing. Before I got them, I was putting three inserts in my baby's diaper at night, a microfiber and two charcoal bamboos. Now I just do the large microfiber over the hemp insert. My baby actually stays dry all night, even though the inserts are wet (the microfiber is always soaked, but the hemp could go for more). They take a while to dry due to their high absorbency so I either line dry in the sun or put in the dryer by themselves. I put them in the wash six times when I first got them to immediately increase absorbency (natural fibers have oils that need to be stripped out). These work like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solution for overnight, but expensive!
customer_reviews.text: They absorb alot!! But I think it's expensive for the price.. there is no similar product in market therefore they are able to get by the price..in my alva baby diaper I use 1 of this insert and another cotton bamboo insert. Cotton bamboo will be close to baby skin.otherwise I feel the shell is getting wet from the hemp insert. I use it for overnight diaper
customer_reviews.author: nitin

customer_reviews.title: Absorbing
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! Just started cloth diapers and I use these bad boys at night and no leaks! I use Alva baby covers with these thirstie inserts and the outter shell is still dry so baby is comfortable while sleeping! They do take a while to dry I do dry them on low heat because of it. We will see how long they last drying them on low! But I deff would use these for night time besides day because they do take awhile to dry and they are super absorbent for long night sleep ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was hesitant to spend so much for these inserts, but I just ordered more of them! My little one was soaking through his diapers (cloth and disposables both) multiple times a night. We have been using these inserts for the past week and have had not a single leak! They are very soft and the absorbency is off the charts! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Angelbaby13_7

customer_reviews.title: I recommend these to all cloth diapering parents
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and absorbent. Keeps my heavy wetter feeling dry for overnights. I like that these are very trim as well, so you can double up on them if needed. They’re STURDY. The only downside is that they do curl up a bit on the edges if you dry them in the dryer, but it’s more cosmetic and doesn’t affect the function at all. Five stars
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best. Super absorbent, and just work fabulously. I have had no issues whatsoever with these. Keep in mind that they do take a considerable amount of time to dry. In the summer, I find that they are able to dry fairly quickly in the sun outside. Otherwise, two to three times in the dryer works.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: I'm never going back to cotton or microfiber
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was wetting through her microfiber and cotton inserts within 2 hours so I knew it was time to do something different. I got one pack of these to try out and she can make it for hours with just this insert. It's super thin so you can even add hemp on top of it for extra absorption. We can't get much more than 4 hours, though. Although, her diaper is usually changed within that period of time anyway so unless she has a particularly heavy wet we are good.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie P.

customer_reviews.title: great inserts!
customer_reviews.text: I'm CDing kid number 2 and have used thirsties for both, but this was the first pack of hemp inserts I have bough. Wow! Wish I had come upon these sooner. Very absorbent, yet very soft. barely curls at the edges when dried, pliable (some of my other brands are really stiff). I use these as doublers for my nighttime diapers (either stretchy flats or a GMD fitted or prefold).
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great - but takes a LOT to dry them
customer_reviews.text: Super absorbent, soft, and otherwise great; however because they are so absorbing, they require a minimum of two (sometimes three) dryer cycles to fully dry. We hang them overnight if there’s time enough between uses. They are expensive, but do work well with our G-diaper or similar covers.
customer_reviews.author: LisaLedbelly

customer_reviews.title: My favorite liners minus the holes
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are the best! Super absorbant and like everyone else has mentioned, take longer to dry. However, I much prefer them to any other material for inserts. Super disappointed the plastic tags they used damaged all of the inserts putting holes in the pads. Didn't notice them until after the first wash. Wish they would stop piercing the inserts and find another way to package these.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Solved all my leaking issues.
customer_reviews.text: These inserts have been a complete lifesaver. My first child had consistent leaks in her hybrid (two-in-one) Grovia diapers. I thought it was a fit issue. It was not. It was an absorbency issue. Ever since I added one of these to every diaper, leaks are a non-issue. I use them for my 24 month old and my two month old. Works fantastic for both. They do take longer to dry, so I add two dry bath towels to the dry cycle and that helps speed up the process. Completely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Super Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: Most of my CDs came with microfiber or bamboo covered microfiber inserts, so these have been absolutely wonderful to add for absorbency (especially overnight)! I wish they were a little cheaper, but they are awesome! They are very slim and don't make the diaper super bulky, especially given their level of absorbency.
customer_reviews.author: MCarrero

customer_reviews.title: Very trim; perfect for a second insert in a hybrid system.
customer_reviews.text: These are a great addition to my stash - I use the Flip Hybrid system and these are perfect to add underneath a Stay Dry insert to increase absorbency without adding bulk. I wash them with the Flip inserts and they're stain-free and very trim. I've tried three other second inserts (including the highly reviewed Charcoal Bamboo ones--which leaked and were ridiculously bulky) and these were easily the best. The only thing more absorbent is using two Stay Dry inserts, but that's bulkier and not always necessary.
customer_reviews.author: KBH

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I started cloth diapering my babe in the beginning of April. I have used several different inserts, and Thirstie’s is my favorite! They’re my go to’s for night time absorbency. They’re super soft and hold a lot of liquid. They do warp a little bit after tumble drying, but not enough to cause issues. They also take a while to fully dry, but that just goes to show how much liquid they hold onto. So, if you’re patient, these are the inserts for you. Just pay attention to the size you’re purchasing, I recently ordered size large and they were quite bigger than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: I just bought another pack!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe these worked overnight for our heavy wetter! I added this to our regular day diaper (we use Gdiapers with an insert but I'm not sure what the insert is unfortunately because it has something to do with how well the system works) and added this on the bottom since people said it absorbs more slowly because it's hemp. And it worked so well for overnight, I was shocked! This is our new overnight system, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: ak

customer_reviews.title: Good Inserts, But Take Forever to Dry!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these hemp inserts for our 3 month old. She is a "heavy wetter" so we needed something that would get her through at least 4-6 hours at night. These work very well, however, they take forever to dry! They definitely need more than one cycle in the dryer. If you plan on using them nightly and air dry your inserts, you will probably need to buy a few of these so you don't have to worry about doing laundry every day and waiting for them to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Deal Queen

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bulletproof doublers!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the most amazing doublers!!!! We primarily use Bum Genius Pockets and AIOs but when I saw these I had to give them a try. I was desperate for a reliable overnight setup! This under a snapped down BG insert in a BG pocket diaper is absolutely bulletproof!!!! Nothing compares! And having my son wake up dry is worth every penny! Everything else he would wake up soaked in a puddle and I would have to wash his whole bed and mine if he was sleeping with us, big pain in the butt!!! I would recommend these to anyone who is looking for added absorbency or a bullet proof overnight solution!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany C.

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent and trim!
customer_reviews.text: This is the most absorbent insert I've ever tried, but I'm most impressed by how thin it is. The trimmest option I've found is laying this insert in a Flip cover, I think it's just as trim as a disposable. I ended up going back and ordering enough to replace all the other inserts I had for my pocket diapers, too. My only complaint is that it takes awhile to dry, but with how much liquid it holds, that's hardly surprising.
customer_reviews.author: cderond

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size after washing
customer_reviews.text: This 4-pack came as 2 sets of 2, measuring 6.5 inches by 14 inches. After a hot wash and dry, they shrank down to 5.25 inches by 13.5 inches, perfect for stuffing in a pocket cloth diaper or adding extra absorbency to other styles of cloth diapers!
customer_reviews.author: polymathamy

customer_reviews.title: Personally not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: They are very expensive for what they are. If you are in search for a product that will offer fewer diaper changes with longer-lasting absorption, I would recommend Zorb inserts sold on Etsy- or -surprisingly- charcoal bamboo inserts by Alva.
customer_reviews.author: Avalon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for heavy wetters
customer_reviews.text: Love these. When I was trying anything and everything to get my daughter's diaper to last overnight without leaking, these were the only thing that worked. When she started to have leaks at nap time, the first thing I tried was adding a hemp insert to her nap time diaper and it immediately solved that problem, too. They're very absorbent, and while they do lose their shape a little and get a little stiff after constant washing and use, I haven't noticed any decrease in effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and decided to order some. I like the fact that they are thin for overnight diaper. I pair it with a microfiber insert. Before this insert I was using a microfiber paired with the osocozy prefolds. That worked great as well but did not like the fact that it was so bulky. I am truly amazed how great these inserts are! They are not bulky and are very absorbent. Inserts are quite large when you first get them but shrink when you wash them. I just love these hemp inserts and best decision to buy them. I will be buying more over time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite hemp inserts!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far our favorite hemp inserts. I've tried a few varieties, but always come back to these. They are slim, but thick and work well. We currently use one of these inside a fitted diaper (under a flap) for our 25lb 1 year old son. I can count on these to hold a lot of liquid and not leak as long as there is a more quick absorbing fabric on top of it. Love love love! We actually bought the bigger version as well, but I love how slim and just plain not bulky these are!
customer_reviews.author: Aileen

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent! More sleep!
customer_reviews.text: Use these with prefolds for my 2+ month old infant son, typically for before bedtime change or our middle of the night change. He is a heavy wetter and has slept 6-8 hours with these. I wash them and dry them with the prefolds, so far so good. They add some bulk but not much, still fits well in the thirsties covers. We bought two packs and that leaves us about two per night, which is plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbant and perfect for overnight use!
customer_reviews.text: These inserts are very absorbant! I use them in my bumgenius freetime diapers overnight and I never have leaks. Only downfall is how long they take to dry. I pop them in the dryer for 20 min and then hang them to dry in the sun or overnight. Since I only use them at night I ordered 2, 2 packs since I wash them every 2 days. That way I always have dry ones too.
customer_reviews.author: Cara

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cloth boosters!!!
customer_reviews.text: These cloth boosters are WONDERFUL! I bought (2) 2 packs and one of these hemp inserts plus one microfiber insert in our pocket diapers gets us 4-5 hours of absorption for my 5month old moderate wetter. I love the Thirsties brand for their duo wraps, and now even more for these inserts!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey M.

customer_reviews.title: Best hemp inserts I've used
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best hemp inserts for maximum absorbancy! Very soft for hemp, thin profile, but 6 layers so as absorbant as it gets for being so slim. Good price per insert compared with other brands that don't have as many layers or absorb as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson13

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other hemp inserts and nothing compares to these. I pair with a microfiber insert in my pocket diapers and this combination keeps leaks away. My daughter is a very heavy wetter and this holds up to a lot of pee much better than a prefold.
customer_reviews.author: B. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, amazing absorbancy
customer_reviews.text: We have AlvaBaby and Mama Koala pockets that come with microfiber inserts. My baby is 4 months old and I noticed the diapers were leaking more than occasionally. At first, I tried to stuff them with my cotton prefolds topped with the microfiber, but that added a lot of bulk. I ordered these and am very impressed. I stuff the pockets with one hemp and one microfiber insert. So far, no leaks, even when in the carseat or activity saucer, where compression leaks are likely.
customer_reviews.author: RachelRush

customer_reviews.title: Super Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I use these In my pocket diapers for nighttime. I layer a folded bamboo burp cloth on top of the hemp inside the pocket to pull the moisture out quickly, then lock it in. They are wonderfully absorbent and don’t crinkle on the edges. Just remember, it needs to be washed multiple times to be cleaned and absorb properly. I wash them with my diapers 3 times and leave them in while I finish my other loads. 6 times seems to do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: CaitCait

customer_reviews.title: so I'm very glad to have found these
customer_reviews.text: Hallelujah no more leaking overnight diapers! My baby sleeps 12-13 hours at night and if I change her diaper she wakes up and has a hard time going back to sleep. This insert inside her Thirsties natural AIO diaper with a fleece stay dry liner on top keep her dry and contained the entire time. Took me a few months to find the right combination, so I'm very glad to have found these! (I ordered large even though my baby was only 3 months at the time. They fit into her diapers at night just fine)
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Heidenthal

customer_reviews.title: Absorbant but holes after a couple washes...
customer_reviews.text: These are really absorbant which is great because my babe is a very heavy wetter.... I was disappointed though because after a couple washes to prep these inserts they developed a couple little holes in the top layer of the fabric. They still work but I’m not sure how long they will hold up. Hopefully I just got a bad batch....
customer_reviews.author: Kim P

customer_reviews.title: Stopped the leaks!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to double with bamboo/cotton inserts because my son was having a lot of leaking. So far, its worked! I was a little hesitant to spend the money not knowing if it would stop leaks, but I'm very glad I did. They continue to look clean, especially when dried in the sun. They do take a while to dry so leaving them outside to dry in the sun seems to be the best option.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren E

customer_reviews.title: Sponges
customer_reviews.text: These babies absorb so well. My only dislike is that they are on the heavy side and tend to bunch up in my pocket diapers and not stay in place. But, you can’t argue with how well they absorb! I love their absorbency. Heads up: they take a while to dry due to all those magical layers.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Van Noordwyk

customer_reviews.title: Ultra thin, super absorbent, and softer than most others!  The. Best.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried all kinds of inserts for our pocket diapers and these are by far my favorite. They're great for our heavy wetter. They are super thin and super absorbent and they aren't stiff as a board after hanging to dry--a combination we haven't found elsewhere. It's true, they take significantly longer to dry than any other inserts we've tried (bamboo, micro terry, other cotton/hemp blends), but it's worth it for how trim & absorbent & soft they are. We pair these with micro terry and they hold a ton of liquid. We keep buying more to replace other inserts that don't work as well. Can't recommend highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi Croy

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent. They do look large when they come ...
customer_reviews.text: These liners do exactly what I expected of them. Super absorbent. They do look large when they come but after prepping them they shrink down to normal size. I use these as a backup liner paired with bamboo on top (bamboo for fast absorbency and hemp for max capacity). Perfect match! and I use this method with every diaper now for over 2 months with my almost 2yr old and haven't had 1 leak! Hopefully they last but so far they are awesome! I bought two to test them and after a month decided I had to have enough of them for my whole set. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Justy M. H.

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to start by saying I am very new and inexperienced in cloth diapering. I bought these to use in a thirsties cover for my toddler just for bed time. She is potty trained and wakes up dry most mornings but I wanted to put one on her for accidents. Maybe I'm using these wrong but she finds them very uncomfortable. They bunch up a lot and she's constantly picking at her diaper area. They do an okay job holding in the pee when she does have accidents at night. When I take them off of her after an accident the smell is strong and her skin is very damp. I never experienced this with disposables.
customer_reviews.author: Alecia

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cloth diapering!!!
customer_reviews.text: These make a huge difference for our little girl. She's tiny for her age (just over 9 lbs at 2 months), but we were fortunate that she started sleeping through the night. She was soaking her cloth diaper though, which caused a little diaper rash. We added one of these at bedtime to her prefold cloth diaper and it really made a difference. No more sopping diapers! They help the diaper absorb at least 3-4 times as much as before while still feeling substantially dryer to the touch. Much better for baby's skin, no doubt. Wouldn't diaper without these now!
customer_reviews.author: SAK

customer_reviews.title: Very Average
customer_reviews.text: I have different brands of extra absorbency, and these are my least favorite of them. They’re okay, but they don’t hold as much as my others. They’re not bad, I just probably wouldn’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Clark Griswold

customer_reviews.title: Must-have for cloth diapering
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite doublers! They are very soft-in a flexible way. They are super trim and very absorbent! I’ve been gifted some and come back to purchase because I love these so much.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I love these inserts!!! They are extremely absorbent and last throughout the night. They have a smooth texture so poop is easy to rinse off. They do get stiff when soaked and take a long time to dry, but that is only because they hold so much liquid
customer_reviews.author: TracyRenee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for nighttime diapers
customer_reviews.text: Great inserts for nap/night time diapers. Ive struggled to find a insert that works for my heavy wetter but these are perfect. I use one insert with 2 bamboo inserts and havent had a leaking issue since
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Cloth diapers leak
customer_reviews.text: I prepped these as directed by manufacturer. They do work better than microfiber inserts alone. I used these during the day under a microfiber insert with fuzzi Bunn pocket diaper. I have decided all cloth diapers leak no matter what you do. I do change my little guy every 2 hours even. They also shrink drastically and take forever to dry, which isn't a huge deal if cloth diapers didn't leak
customer_reviews.author: Candice MacClamrock

customer_reviews.title: Great to Add Absorbency!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. We use them under a microfiber insert in a normal diaper (flip cover and microfiber insert), and then most often added to all-in-one diaper under the microfiber inserts (bumgenius freetime) for nap time or night time to significantly improve absorbancy up to 10-12 hours! After I got a pack to test, we kept getting more as little one got bigger and heavier wetter. I wouldn't bother with getting the smaller size unless you really need less fluff or have a really little heavy wetter.
customer_reviews.author: Becky D.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent absorbency
customer_reviews.text: Our baby is a heavy soaker, and this is the best diaper liner so far. When combined with a microfiber insert, it really holds its liquid. It works better than bamboo, which was not that helpful for our heavy soaker, and even works better than a flour sack towel! It’sa little pricy, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Derek L. Witty

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent, heavy duty, thin
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent but it takes forever to hang dry and is now softer after some washes. Overall great insert! I needed a more absorbent than bamboo. I have a heavy wetter baby, and I have to use these all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Britt

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep baby dry with long nights!
customer_reviews.text: We add these to our cloth diapers for bedtime and they have helped to significantly reduce leaks now that our little girl is sleeping 8-10 hours a night. We put them under a charcoal insert and she wakes “dry” (meaning her clothes and bed are dry) 9/10 nights.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great inserts!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE! These are my most absorbent insert. I pair it with a microfiber insert and I nearly never have leaks anymore! I’d love to buy more, but for now I use these ones for night time when baby were the most and they’ve been working great for us!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Hemp inserts have been a game hanger for cloth diapering. Add a flour sack towel and you’re golden! P.s. I love the size small for my little guy! He’s a year old and I still prefer the smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Capito

customer_reviews.title: I like these
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to explore other hemp inserts, but these appear to be working well. You definitely need these to pair with your microfiber inserts if you have any.
customer_reviews.author: Aila

customer_reviews.title: Great Absorbency. Perfect overnight use.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this as night time insert. Absolutely worthy. Saved from using thousands of disposable diapers. Works great for toddlers as well as without diaper cover. Can be used with regular underwear until the child completely stops bed wetting.
customer_reviews.author: Aquarium

customer_reviews.title: These are great for over night, and road trips!
customer_reviews.text: These have shown great absorbancy. My twins are getting a little older and do not get up multiple times in the night anymore. This means no diaper changes for hours while they sleep, and they started leaking out of their cloth diapers. I actually use a combination of a hemp liner, and a charcoal liner, in their bed time diapers. Works wonders! Side note: these are also great for travel, when you are in situations when you can't change a diaper right away. We have to travel for hours to see my family, and using these liners makes it so easy to go a little longer between diaper changes (stops).
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Great for Heavy Wetter
customer_reviews.text: My kid is a super soaker. We have tried a number of inserts for his overnight diaper, and this is the only insert that has given enough absorbency to work. For overnights, we use two of these, a five layer bamboo/microfiber combo and a osocozy cotton doubler in a mama koala pocket. It’s a lot, but it’s saved us from having to go trial and error with fitted diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Read

customer_reviews.title: Super-absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my baby is a heavy wetter and they held up great oved night. They are easy to clean. They become a little wrinkled during washing, but are easy to press out with your hands. They are difficult to dry but I assume that is because hemp is so super absorbent. Will purchase more in the immediate future and recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Very Absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for overnight use. They are incredibly absorbent and work well when paired with Green Mountain Diapers' prefolds. I'll be buying more of these in the future. Only negative is they take a while to dry, which makes sense because of how absorbent they are.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Souza

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my cloth diapering problems!
customer_reviews.text: These inserts were exactly what I needed. I am a first time mom and have been cloth diapering, and loving it, until I started having major leaking issues. I did some research and came upon these inserts and decided to give them a try and I am so glad I did! Since using one of these inserts under the regular bamboo inserts I normally use, I have not had a single leak and my baby's diaper isn't bulky at all since these are nice and thin. I love these and constantly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Simply the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I used these originally paired with micro in my BG 4.0 as an overnight solution, but I just bought more for day use as well. Once my son turned one he seemed to be drinking more water and having daily diaper leaks. He would get the "compression leaks" whenever he was sitting. I has NEVER had a leak with these inserts. He sleeps for up to 10 hours with this insert and not once have we had a leak. I originally bought bamboo inserts and had terrible leaks after an hour of use. These do take a long time to dry, but I'm not sure you can have the best of both worlds when it comes to super absorbent inserts.
customer_reviews.author: kreardon

customer_reviews.title: Lifesavers for this new to cloth diapering mama of 3 in diapers!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to cloth diapering, but have found these to be a lifesaver! I ordered 2 sizes, the smaller for my 12 month old & the larger for my 2 year old twins, who will hopefully be potty trained soon. I’m the meantime, I rely on these suckers when I need added absorbency but don’t want added bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: eh. could take it or leave it
customer_reviews.text: I am not thrilled with the thirsties cloth diaper system. I feel like the covers are expensive, the snaps fall off and are generally too much to fasten with a squirming baby. The inserts are not as absorbent as I hoped they would be and have to be changed frequently. In addition, the two piece system makes it slightly difficult because you have to get the cover positioned correctly and then add the insert which can be tricky. If you want to use cloth diapers I would try another brand that offers a one piece option or maybe one that has a slot for the insert so that it becomes a one piece at changing time.
customer_reviews.author: pinkflamingo

customer_reviews.title: solved overnight leaks
customer_reviews.text: this was a quick and easy solution to overnight leaks for our well-hydrated side sleeper. i use with a bamboo charcoal insert in a pocket style, or add one to an all in one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Noto

customer_reviews.title: Thin, absorbent, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love love love. Cant say more about them. Absorb very good, I use only two of the hemp, and another bamboo insert. They can go throughout the night no problem.
customer_reviews.author: yuan

customer_reviews.title: Using for night time cloth pocket diapers
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I'm so glad I got those! Now I used this along with one bamboo liner and a thin microfiber liner for night time for my 3 months old baby. I'm so amazed at it's absorbency. It's relatively thin but does its job. I got large for my son and initially did look big in the Wagreego or baby goal cloth pocket diapers but after one use, they shrank to the other sizes of other regular liners. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: LOVE these! These are my go to nighttime solution
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! These are my go to nighttime solution. I pair it with a bamboo insert and my 6 month old daughter is good for 10-12 hours. Her little bum is dry and not red at all in the mornings. They are totally worth the extra cost. I currently have 4 which gets us from diaper laundry day to diaper laundry day. I would recommend buying just enough, one per night, to get you through between wash days. They do take longer to dry but I just make sure to do my diaper laundry first so my inserts can catch 2 cycles through the dryer.
customer_reviews.author: WashingtonApple

customer_reviews.title: Not as absorbent as I’d hoped
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed with the absorbency of this product. I purchased these for my 5yo and I gave a few washes. I ended up doubling up with the inserts and still got leakage.
customer_reviews.author: Amber E. Marciano

customer_reviews.title: Best inserts.
customer_reviews.text: The best I've found! I wish I tried these first so I would make my stash of these only! I couple it with the microfiber insert that came included with the pocket diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Annyoceli

customer_reviews.title: Toddler still leaks through these at night.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because of the reviews that they helped with leaks at night. Still had leaks, even after multiple washes and nights of giving these a try. My toddler does pee A LOT at night, so this may still work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and thin
customer_reviews.text: I combine these with a microfiber or bamboo insert to maximize absorbency. I appreciate how thin these are so it does not create bulk in the already bulky cloth diaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Brumm

customer_reviews.title: Some don't lay flat
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought a pack of these and loved them because they are so absorbent and not too thick. I ordered 2 more packs, but they weren't as good. They are as absorbent, but, after washing, the inserts are all bunchy and don't lay very flat. I am disappointed by this and don't understand what this difference is between the ones I bought originally and the ones I bought a few months later.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

product_meta.title: Thirsties Hemp Inserts Size Large, 4 Pack
feature_bullets: Designed for use an accessory to your current cloth diapering system as extra absorbency for heavy wetters or nighttime use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,382 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
